data.name: HVAC_ChangeAirFilter_Name
data.value: Change Air Filter

data.name: HVAC_ChangeAirFilter_Description
data.value: Turn off the HVAC system, open the filter access panel, remove the old filter, use a vacuum cleaner in the area, insert a new filter of the same size with the airflow arrow in the correct direction, then close the panel and restart the system.

data.name: HVAC_ProfessionalInspection_Name
data.value: Professional Inspection

data.name: HVAC_ProfessionalInspection_Description
data.value: Schedule a certified HVAC technician to inspect the unit, check refrigerant levels, electrical connections, safety controls, filters, and overall performance, and complete any recommended maintenance according to the manufacturer’s guidance.

data.name: HVAC_CleanVentsAndDucts_Name
data.value: Clean Vents and Ducts

data.name: HVAC_CleanVentsAndDucts_Description
data.value: Remove and vacuum vent covers and registers, wipe them with a damp cloth, and visually inspect accessible duct openings for dust buildup, obstructions, or damage; contact a professional if deeper duct cleaning is needed.

data.name: Plumbing_CheckForLeaks_Name
data.value: Check for Leaks

data.name: Plumbing_CheckForLeaks_Description
data.value: Look under sinks, around the shower, and along exposed pipes for dripping water, damp spots, stains, or corrosion; gently tighten any loose fittings and note issues that require a licensed plumber.

data.name: Plumbing_CleanDrains_Name
data.value: Clean Drains

data.name: Plumbing_CleanDrains_Description
data.value: Remove visible hair and debris from drain covers, flush the drain with hot water, and if needed use a drain snake or a manufacturer-approved cleaner (never mix chemicals) to clear slow or partially clogged drains.

data.name: Plumbing_TestWaterPressure_Name
data.value: Test Water Pressure

data.name: Plumbing_TestWaterPressure_Description
data.value: Attach a simple pressure gauge to an outdoor spigot or faucet, fully open the tap to read the household water pressure, and adjust the pressure regulator or contact a plumber if readings fall outside the recommended range.

data.name: Door_LubricateHinges_Name
data.value: Lubricate Hinges

data.name: Door_LubricateHinges_Description
data.value: Apply lubricant to door hinges to prevent squeaking and ensure smooth operation.

data.name: Door_CheckWeatherstripping_Name
data.value: Check Weatherstripping

data.name: Door_CheckWeatherstripping_Description
data.value: Inspect and replace weatherstripping to maintain energy efficiency.

data.name: Door_TightenHardware_Name
data.value: Tighten Hardware

data.name: Door_TightenHardware_Description
data.value: Check and tighten all door hardware including handles, locks, and hinges.

data.name: Window_CleanWindows_Name
data.value: Clean Windows

data.name: Window_CleanWindows_Description
data.value: Clean glass, frames, and tracks for optimal view and operation.

data.name: Window_CheckSeals_Name
data.value: Check Seals

data.name: Window_CheckSeals_Description
data.value: Inspect window seals and caulking for air leaks and water intrusion.

data.name: Window_LubricateTracks_Name
data.value: Lubricate Tracks

data.name: Window_LubricateTracks_Description
data.value: Clean and lubricate window tracks for smooth opening and closing.

data.name: Garage_LubricateMovingParts_Name
data.value: Lubricate Moving Parts

data.name: Garage_LubricateMovingParts_Description
data.value: Lubricate garage door opener chain, rollers, and hinges.

data.name: Garage_TestSafetyFeatures_Name
data.value: Test Safety Features

data.name: Garage_TestSafetyFeatures_Description
data.value: Test auto-reverse and sensor features for safety compliance.

data.name: Garage_ProfessionalInspection_Name
data.value: Professional Inspection

data.name: Garage_ProfessionalInspection_Description
data.value: Schedule professional inspection of garage door system and springs.

data.name: Safety_TestAlarm_Name
data.value: Test Alarm

data.name: Safety_TestAlarm_Description
data.value: Press test button to ensure alarm is functioning properly.

data.name: Safety_ReplaceBatteries_Name
data.value: Replace Batteries

data.name: Safety_ReplaceBatteries_Description
data.value: Replace batteries in smoke detector or carbon monoxide detector.

data.name: Safety_CleanSensor_Name
data.value: Clean Sensor

data.name: Safety_CleanSensor_Description
data.value: Gently vacuum or wipe sensor to ensure accurate detection.

data.name: Roof_InspectShingles_Name
data.value: Inspect Shingles

data.name: Roof_InspectShingles_Description
data.value: Check for missing, damaged, or curling shingles and repair as needed.

data.name: Roof_CheckForMoss_Name
data.value: Check for Moss

data.name: Roof_CheckForMoss_Description
data.value: Inspect and remove any moss or algae growth on roof surface.

data.name: Roof_ProfessionalInspection_Name
data.value: Professional Inspection

data.name: Roof_ProfessionalInspection_Description
data.value: Schedule professional roof inspection for overall condition assessment.

data.name: Exterior_CleanGutters_Name
data.value: Clean Gutters

data.name: Exterior_CleanGutters_Description
data.value: Remove leaves and debris from gutters and downspouts.

data.name: Exterior_InspectForDamage_Name
data.value: Inspect for Damage

data.name: Exterior_InspectForDamage_Description
data.value: Check exterior for cracks, loose sections, or signs of wear.

data.name: Exterior_PaintTouchUp_Name
data.value: Paint Touch-Up

data.name: Exterior_PaintTouchUp_Description
data.value: Inspect paint and apply touch-ups where needed to prevent deterioration.

data.name: Insulation_InspectForDamage_Name
data.value: Inspect for Damage

data.name: Insulation_InspectForDamage_Description
data.value: Check insulation for moisture damage, settling, or pest infestation.

data.name: Insulation_CheckRValue_Name
data.value: Check R-Value

data.name: Insulation_CheckRValue_Description
data.value: Verify insulation levels meet recommended R-value for your climate zone.

data.name: Insulation_SealAirLeaks_Name
data.value: Seal Air Leaks

data.name: Insulation_SealAirLeaks_Description
data.value: Inspect and seal any air leaks around insulation areas.

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrumCompartment_Name
data.value: Rinse Drum Compartment

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrumCompartment_Description
data.value: Run an empty hot wash cycle with a washer cleaner or mild detergent according to the manufacturer’s instructions, then wipe the drum and door gasket to remove residue and leave the door open to dry.

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseSoapCompartment_Name
data.value: Rinse Soap Compartment

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseSoapCompartment_Description
data.value: Pull out the detergent drawer, disassemble removable parts if applicable, rinse them under warm water while brushing away soap buildup, dry the pieces, and slide the drawer back into place.

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrainFilter_Name
data.value: Rinse Drain Filter

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrainFilter_Description
data.value: Locate the drain filter access panel, place a tray or towel underneath, slowly open the cap to drain water, remove the filter, clear away lint and debris, rinse it clean, then reinstall and securely close the cap.

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrainOutlet_Name
data.value: Rinse Drain Outlet

data.name: WashingMachine_RinseDrainOutlet_Description
data.value: Inspect the drain hose connection and standpipe or drain for kinks, buildup, or obstructions, remove any visible lint or debris, and flush the outlet with water to ensure wastewater can flow freely.

data.name: Dishwasher_CleanFilter_Name
data.value: Clean Filter

data.name: Dishwasher_CleanFilter_Description
data.value: Remove the lower rack, unlock and lift out the filter assembly, rinse filters under warm water while gently brushing away food particles, check for blockages beneath the filter area, then reinstall the filters securely.

data.name: Dishwasher_CleanDoorAndSeals_Name
data.value: Clean Door and Seals

data.name: Dishwasher_CleanDoorAndSeals_Description
data.value: Use a soft cloth and mild detergent to wipe the inner door edges, gasket, and around the seals, removing residue and mold, then dry the surfaces thoroughly to maintain a tight, odor-free seal.

data.name: Generic_RegularInspection_Name
data.value: Regular Inspection

data.name: Generic_RegularInspection_Description
data.value: Perform a visual inspection to check for any issues or needed maintenance.

data.name: Generic_CleanAndMaintain_Name
data.value: Clean and Maintain

data.name: Generic_CleanAndMaintain_Description
data.value: Clean and perform basic maintenance to keep item in good condition.
